Name: Scarab with depiction of the god of the Nile flood
Description: Steatite scarab-shaped amulet with stylised rendering of head, wing-cases, v-marks at shoulder. The incised motif on underside shows the Nile Flood (Hapy) personified as an androgynous figure crowned by a papyrus marsh, holding a sacred water-vessel, and kneeling on the hieroglyph nb 'lord' or 'all'.
